sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ganesh Dahal)
articles.description: In this article, Ganesh Dahal explains how the features have evolved since reusable blocks were officially released in WordPress 5.0 — and how the two have converged in WordPress 6.3 to form a powerful feature capable of allowing content creators to sync content and design patterns consistently in pages and posts.
articles.title: Exploring Enhanced Patterns In WordPress 6.3

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Scanlon)
articles.description: Branches are a really nice (and safe) way to configure or reconfigure your database without fear of screwing up the production database. Let’s take a closer look at how branching works with [Neon](https://bit.ly/46cEgX1), and the good news is, you probably already know how it works!
articles.title: Getting Started With Neon Branching

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: We’re talking about running grassroots conferences and meet-ups. What does it take to organize a small industry event for your community? Drew McLellan talks to WDC’s Alex Older to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 65 With Alex Older: How Do You Run A Grassroots Conference?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: Adrian’s kicking off a two-part series, sharing his journey as a lead developer. In the process, you will learn about the lessons and insights Adrian gained at work, including the strategies that went into the technical stack of the project and what it looks like to collaborate with a team he is leading for the first time.
articles.title: WaterBear: Building A Free Platform For Impactful Documentaries (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Jhey Tompkins)
articles.description: With the new CSS `linear()` easing function on the horizon, the possibilities of what we can do to create natural-feeling animations and transitions in the future are greatly expanded. Jhey Tompkins looks at the current state of CSS easing in this article and demonstrates what we can expect from `linear()`, including handy tools to get your hands on it today.
articles.title: The Path To Awesome CSS Easing With The linear() Function

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ben Shih)
articles.description: To help ensure the success of a workshop, Ben Shih introduces the concept of an inclusive workshop. In Part 2 of the series, you will continue to delve deeper into several key principles and guidelines that you can follow during and after the workshop to encourage an inclusive atmosphere.
articles.title: Facilitating Inclusive Online Workshops (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Geoff Graham)
articles.description: This article is a peek behind the curtain of how content is managed here at Smashing Magazine. In it, you’ll get a tour of an article’s full lifecycle, from a basic outline to the sort of thing you’re reading right this second.
articles.title: How Smashing Magazine Uses TinaCMS To Manage An Editorial Workflow

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: Let’s play with images and experiment with CSS masks. The idea is fairly simple: take a single `` tag and harness the power of CSS to accomplish complex hover transitions. Through different demos, you will see how CSS masks combined with gradients allow us to create fancy effects — with efficient, reusable code.
articles.title: Revealing Images With CSS Mask Animations

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ben Shih)
articles.description: Running a workshop can be an effective alternative to traditional, long-standing meetings. To help ensure its success, Ben Shih introduces the concept of an inclusive workshop. In Part 1 of the series, you discover the fundamentals of inclusivity and get some solid guidance on how to plan an inclusive remote workshop.
articles.title: Facilitating Inclusive Online Workshops (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Preethi Sam)
articles.description: Gradients are a powerful CSS feature. We use them for texture, depth, and even to hide parts of elements with CSS masking. This article covers another interesting way to use gradients — as a hover effect that affects the appearance of other elements around the hovered element.
articles.title: Gradients, Blend Modes, And A Really Cool Hover Effect

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Pratik Joglekar)
articles.description: Pratik Joglekar takes a philosophical approach to remind designers about the lost joy within themselves by effectively placing massive importance on mindfulness, introspection, and forward-looking. Without joy, the work we do would feel meaningless. To prevent it from happening, check out a few ideas that would help rediscover that spark of joy.
articles.title: Rediscovering The Joy Of Design

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ramona Schwering)
articles.description: Is the Test Pyramid really dead? Discover the more contemporary testing strategies and evaluate the Test Pyramid’s relevance in today’s software development practices.
articles.title: Long Live The Test Pyramid

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Joas Pambou)
articles.description: In this article, Joas Pambou builds the tool to provide a sentiment score in **real-time** with enhanced user experience by providing multilingual support. You will use an OpenAI library called Whisper that transcribes audio files into text and detects the language, and Gradio, a UI framework, to establish the interface.
articles.title: Generating Real-Time Audio Sentiment Analysis With AI

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let’s get ready for September with some fresh wallpaper designs! Created with love by artists and designers from across the globe, the wallpapers in this collection come in versions with and without a calendar. Enjoy!
articles.title: A September Of Never Ending Adventures (2023 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: Estefania Cassingena Navone
articles.description: Welcome! In a global world where information is available to everyone in just a few clicks, adapting your website and resources to other languages and cultures is essential to succeed. This book will teach you the fundamentals of localization and how to translate your website to reach a global community
articles.title: The Localization Handbook – How to Translate Your Website Into Different World Languages [Full Book]

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Large language models have revolutionized the realm of Natural Language Processing (NLP) and have opened the doors for numerous applications in the tech world. But integrating and deploying these models to design powerful applications often demands a specialized set of tools and understanding. Enter LangChain: a game-changing framework tailored for
articles.title: Learn LangChain for LLM Development

articles.author: Chris Blakely
articles.description: Hey there! Ready to build something cool? In this tutorial, we're going to create a full stack notes app using React, Node.js, and PostgreSQL.  We'll start from scratch and end up with a fully functioning app where you can create, edit, and delete notes. Plus, we're adding validation on
articles.title: Full Stack Project Tutorial – Create A Notes App Using React and Node.js

articles.author: Sophia Iroegbu
articles.description: Hacktoberfest is a month-long event that promotes open-source contributions, collaboration, and projects.  Participating in this event as either a project maintainer or a contributor gives new perspectives to either your project or your career. You also get to meet fun people. This article will walk you through how to
articles.title: A Project Maintainer's Guide to Hacktoberfest

articles.author: Aaron Katz
articles.description: Terraform is a popular Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tool that allows users to define and manage cloud infrastructure in a declarative way.  However, like any tool, Terraform can introduce security risks if not used properly. In this article, we will explore the most common security risks when using Terraform, the
articles.title: Terraform Security Best Practices

articles.author: Quincy Larson
articles.description: This morning while I was eating breakfast, I opened YouTube and saw a video by self-taught developer Brian Cache: "The FASTEST Way to Learn to Code and ACTUALLY Get a Developer Job" (Capital letter emphasis is his own. The video is an 11 minute watch): I love watching these types
articles.title: Self-Taught Developer's Fastest Path to a Developer Job

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Java has been a popular programming language for over two decades. Learning Java is a good way to mastering the fundamentals of modern coding practices.  We just posted a full course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you the basics of Java programming. Alex Dobinca Cristian developed
articles.title: Learn the Basics of Java Programming

articles.author: Valentine Gatwiri
articles.description: Prismane is a free, comprehensive, have-it-all React UI library that provides a broad array of hooks, components, and form validators to help you build beautiful and functional user interfaces. Prismane was designed with performance in mind, ensuring lightning-fast loading times for a better user experience. In this article, you will
articles.title: An Overview of Prismane  – An Open-Source React UI Library

articles.author: Joan Ayebola
articles.description: HTML, which stands for HyperText Markup Language, is the standard markup language used to create webpages. HTML provides a structured way to organize content on a webpage, allowing web developers to present text and media in a clear and meaningful way.  In this article, we'll explore three fundamental HTML
articles.title: How to use HTML Elements – Headings, Paragraphs, and Text Formatting Elements Example

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Nuxt.js has been making waves in the web development world, especially among Vue.js enthusiasts. With its unique capabilities for server-side rendering, static site generation, and single-page applications, Nuxt offers a robust set of features for developers looking to build modern web apps. We just posted a full course on Nuxt
articles.title: Nuxt 3 Course for Beginners
